articles.author: By Ben Spencer Medical Correspondent For The Daily Mail
articles.title: High blood pressure in your 40s and 50s significantly affects the brain in later life - Daily Mail
articles.description: A study by University of Oxford researchers based on brain scans from 37,000 people reveals that raised blood pressure in middle age leads to extensive damage to the 'white matter' of the brain.
articles.content:
High blood pressure in your 40s and 50s significantly affects the brain in later life, researchers have found.
